title: How to Remove Mop and Glo

steps.title: Vacuum the floor to remove all excess dust and debris.
steps.content: Vacuum the floor to remove all excess dust and debris. Move as much furniture as you can. You will need to have access to all the areas that were covered in Mop and Glo.

steps.title: Open all the windows.
steps.content: Open all the windows. Although this method is non-toxic, mixing a vinegar solution leads to a strong smell.

steps.title: Pour 1/2 cup (118ml) of white vinegar into one gallon (3.
steps.content: Pour 1/2 cup (118ml) of white vinegar into one gallon (3. 8l) of hot water. The water should be cool enough that you can submerge your hands in it. The vinegar is acidic and it brings up the waxy residue from the Mop and Glo.

steps.title: Add several drops of lemon, orange or clove essential oils.
steps.content: Add several drops of lemon, orange or clove essential oils. These oils subdue the harsh vinegar smell.

steps.title: Fill another bucket with clean warm water for rinsing.
steps.content: Fill another bucket with clean warm water for rinsing.

steps.title: Dip a microfiber cloth in the bucket and wring it out.
steps.content: Dip a microfiber cloth in the bucket and wring it out. Keep the amount of solution and water you use to a minimum to keep the subfloor from getting wet and the wood from warping. Start scrubbing from the farthest corner until you come to the doorway.

steps.title: Rinse sections of the floor with clean microfiber cloths after the solution sits for a five to 10 minutes.
steps.content: Rinse sections of the floor with clean microfiber cloths after the solution sits for a five to 10 minutes. The vinegar needs a few minutes to break through the residue. Make sure to rinse well.

steps.title: Vacuum the laminate floor to remove dust and debris.
steps.content: Vacuum the laminate floor to remove dust and debris. You don’t want anything to remain that could scuff the surface. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Purchase some chemical stripping gloves to use in this process.
steps.content: Purchase some chemical stripping gloves to use in this process. Keep a bucket nearby to place damp rags and sponges.

steps.title: Purchase full strength acetone to clean the film.
steps.content: Purchase full strength acetone to clean the film. You may need to get this at a specialty cleaning store. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open all the windows as you ready the space for Mop and Glo removal.
steps.content: Open all the windows as you ready the space for Mop and Glo removal. Since you shouldn’t use large amounts of water on laminate, you usually have to use harsh chemicals to remove film.

steps.title: Pour the acetone in a spray bottle.
steps.content: Pour the acetone in a spray bottle. Apply liberally and clean with scrap rags.

steps.title: Don’t use harsh brushes on a laminate floor.
steps.content: Don’t use harsh brushes on a laminate floor. You may be able to employ a non-stick scrubber sponge or #0000 steel wool to bring up tough film.

steps.title: Scrub hard until the film is renewed and your floor shines.
steps.content: Scrub hard until the film is renewed and your floor shines. It takes plenty of hard work to get the Mop and Glo up. However, once you’ve removed it, you can use water and a microfiber cloth to clean your laminate flooring.
